item.title: Welcome
item.description: Testing out using hugo for blogging. I was going to bring over some old blog posts to here, but decided it might be better to update those posts and roll them out later. Today I’ll just link to the video of the transient material instance (MI) system that was put in not long ago. This system allows every object to have it’s own procedurally generated MI to handle various parameters of VFX materials such as volume, colors, patterns.

item.title: Ugly Terrain
item.description: Getting tired of pure voxel terrain again, so I’m going to move voxel system to more of a detail terrain painting system. GPU Clipmaps are cool again, and much more flexible when it comes to foliage deco – so hopefully this will be the last ugly terrain screenshot. Making the system to generate foliage with raycasts as seen in ye old island demo as fun for programmer art, however for deco painting artists don’t like that kind of thing.

item.title: Migrer vers Hugo depuis Jekyll
item.description:
Déplacez le contenu statique vers static

Jekyll a une règle comme quoi tout répertoire qui ne commence pas par _ sera copié tel-quel dans le répertoire _site. Hugo garde tout le contenu statique dans le répertoire static. Vous devez donc déplacer tout ce type de contenu là-dedans. Avec Jekylll, l’arborescence ressemblant à ceci :

▾ <root>/
    ▾ images/
        logo.png

item.title: Terrain and Biomes and Flora oh my
item.description: So I dusted off the terrain / biome system to hook it up to the voxel terrain system, since it makes a lot more sense to model very large landmasses in a way people can understand. Density functions by parts isn’t a bad thing, but even if you expose this with a UI flow graph – who the fuck is going to understand it that also wants to use a flow graph chart?

item.title: Voxel Terrain Sector Preview
item.description: Got the basic voxel terrain in today. The most time was spent on new ways to generate and enqueue Voxels, RenderMesh, PhysicsMesh in various worker threads and sync them amongst all the subsystems. Also refactored some of the math library and noise generation while in there to avoid overlap. Voxel Terrain Sectors 2x1x2 The scale of this image required me to adjust my camera… typical player could be about as big as a pixel here… going to hook this up to my biome and erosion simulation next.

item.title: Isosurface Extraction done quick
item.description: Cross post from Google+: Voxels and Triplanar Mapping only took a day and a half thanks to the excellent docs from Nvidia and my awesome little engine that could. Going to work in real-time editing and maybe tessellation guided by isosurface extraction later if I don’t get sidetracked with other big features. This is a CPU converted isosurface to standard mesh to use the CPU side physics. eg voxels -> mesh.
